structure.unit: A AUTOMATED MOTOR VEHICLE REGISTRATION SYSTEM

law.text:
No person, including a county clerk and his employees, shall willfully utilize or tamper with a telecommunications terminal, or associated devices, linked to the automated vehicle registration and titling system and capable of entering data or electronic signals into, altering information stored within, or obtaining information or electronic signals from, the automated vehicle registration and titling system unless:
He has current authorization from the commissioner of the Department of Vehicle Regulation to utilize the system;
He has, previous to utilizing such terminal or associated devices in a given county, satisfactorily completed an orientation as given by the Department of Vehicle Regulation concerning the forms, procedures, and use of the system, as certified by the county clerk or county clerk-elect of the county in which his use of the system will take place; and
He has been assigned, and has received, a unique personal identifying code or device from the Department of Vehicle Regulation.
law.history: Created 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 164, sec. 49, effective July 15, 1982.
